title: 105_hr2949
content: The Missouri and Middle Mississippi Rivers Enhancement Project is outlined in Section 1. The Middle Mississippi River and Missouri River are defined in this section. The project authorized by the Secretary of the Army includes protection and enhancement activities to be developed within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of the Army shall develop a plan within 180 days to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River and the middle Mississippi River without adversely affecting water-related needs of the region. The plan developed by the Secretary of the Army aims to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the region surrounding the Missouri River and the middle Mississippi River. This includes activities such as modifying navigation training structures and creating side channels to support habitat enhancement. The plan aims to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat by modifying navigation structures, creating side channels, restoring island habitat, establishing criteria for activities, and monitoring project success. The plan includes activities for modifying navigation structures, creating side channels, restoring island habitat, establishing criteria for activities, and monitoring project success through physical and biological monitoring. The Secretary will implement these activities using available funds and existing authority for unconstructed features of the project. The Secretary may design and construct project features to accelerate activities for fish and wildlife habitat protection in the Missouri River or middle Mississippi River, integrating them with other Federal and State activities. The Secretary shall integrate activities with other Federal and State activities and this section does not affect existing authorities for specific projects. Nebraska is authorized by various water resources development acts, with no new regulatory authority conferred. Public participation is required in developing and carrying out the plan. The Secretary must provide public participation in developing and carrying out the plan, comply with applicable laws, and ensure cost sharing for non-federal entities. The Secretary must comply with applicable laws, including the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. Cost sharing for the project requires a non-Federal share not exceeding 25 percent and a Federal share capped at $5,000,000 per activity. The Federal government will be responsible for the operation and maintenance of the project. An authorization of $50,000,000 is provided for the Federal share of activities from 1999 to 2004. Authorization of Appropriations: $50,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for the Federal share of activities under this section from 1999 to 2004. Funds will be managed by the Mississippi Valley Division of the Army Corps of Engineers and distributed to the appropriate Districts.
